profileText: A Delegate from New York; born in Oyster Bay, Long Island, N.Y., July 26, 1734; elected as a Delegate to the Continental Congress in 1788 but did not attend; died November 21, 1819.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Jones, Samuel. Communications from the Late Honorable Samuel Jones to John Pintard, Esq. New York: N.p., 1821.

researchRecord.name: In the legal documents and letters relating to the Brotherton Indians, 1795-1843, 8 items.

recordLocation.name: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

researchRecord.name: 1761-1803, 1 volume.
researchRecord.description: A receipt book, 1761-1803, of New York City lawyer Samuel Jones, recording payment for legal services, rent, boundary settlements, and taxes in addition to various court fees, including judge's, sheriff's, clerk's, recorder's, and crier's fees.

researchRecord.name: In the treaties, etc. Onondaga Tribe of Indians, 1788 Sept. 12, 2 leaves.
researchRecord.description: Treaty is signed by Samuel Jones.

researchRecord.name: 1760-1819, 0.8 cubic foot.
researchRecord.description: The collection of Samuel Jones contains papers received by him when he served as a counselor in New York City. The papers include wills, land patents, a slave manumission paper, 1779, and other legal documents. Also included are letters regarding Indian affairs at Ft. William Henry, Permaquid Point, Maine, 1701, and a copy of a letter from a New York group to the Connecticut Committee of Correspondence regarding the formation of a colonial congress, 1774.

researchRecord.name: In the records of the British Board of Commissioners for Superintending Embarkations, 1783, 1 volume, 1 container, 1 microfilm reel.
researchRecord.description: Proceedings are signed by Samuel Jones. Collection forms part of the papers and collection of Peter Force.
